title: I challenge any Rioter to explain to me the value of allied creepblock
body: You know, the kind where you go to cs an enemy minion but you can't because _you get stuck inside your own minionwave_. I think creep block in general is garbage but you can, at least, make an argument for enemy creepblock even if it's just so that certain passives exist but I fail to see how getting screwed over by your _own_ minions adds any outplay potential to the game, it just pisses me off and makes me want to not play melee top laners.

Minion block is not THAT big of a problem and if someone keeps falling into minion traps then they should consider using the solution that's already in the game, ghost.

it's bigger than just getting stuck though. it's how minions and everything coded as such negatively impacts pathing since the most recent change to the system.  

if I click the other side of my minions I should walk around or between them, occasionally you will instead bug out for a second as the minions slightly move and screw up your pathing.

yeah I've seen this happen, the problem is the actual bounding box of the units, I think the hitboxes are actual boxes, meaning that they are invisible cubes that surround every unit, when the minions position themselves in an arc formation, in between cubes appear these angled corner like empty spaces that are accessible so the game paths you through it, the other side though is too narrow for your own hitbox to go through, this results in the minions either being pushed away a little or you being denied entry, what happens in game is a bit of both.

The problem, and the actual creep block, happens when one of the minions moves a little and your own hitbox is squished in between both of their hitboxes, the path that was there a while ago in the shape of an angled corner is now a hallway that's too narrow for you to fit in, so you can't get out of there until one of the hitboxes is cleared.

The solution to this is probably incresing minion's hitboxes size, that way you reduce "angled corner spaces" in between them but there will ALWAYS be a chance for someone to get stuck so Riot would need to implement some kind of AI where minions recognize each others proximity and react accordingly... naturally, this kind of technology takes time to code and we'd be very naive to think that they aren't actively working on a solution at this very moment.
Imagine trying to  CS against a Nautilus/Maokai or some lane bully, who can literally stand on top of their minions. You would not be able to CS. Thats why minion block exists.
